javadoc:
Implementation for representing connections between two tools.
 Acts as the middle man for the connection in order to filter the
 events.

methods.javadoc:
Default constructor used when there is a problem restoring state
 on the workspace; want the restore() method to still work.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Default constructor used when there is a problem restoring state
 on the workspace; want the restore() method to still work.

methods.javadoc: Saves the Tool Connection into an XML element.
methods.name: saveToXml
methods.comment: Saves the Tool Connection into an XML element.

methods.javadoc:
restores the ToolConnection from an XML element
@param root XML element to restore ToolConnection from.
methods.name: restoreFromXml
methods.comment: restores the ToolConnection from an XML element

params.name: root
params.comment: XML element to restore ToolConnection from.

methods.javadoc: Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is supported for the benefit of hashtables such as those provided by java.util.Hashtable.
methods.name: hashCode
methods.comment:
Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is
 supported for the benefit of hashtables such as those provided by
 java.util.Hashtable.

methods.javadoc: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.
methods.name: equals
methods.comment: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

methods.javadoc: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment:
Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the
 toString method returns a string that
 "textually represents" this object. The result should
 be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a
 person to read.

methods.javadoc: Return true if the connection changed.
methods.name: hasChanged
methods.comment: Return true if the connection changed.

methods.javadoc:
Update the events that are consumed and produced, as the tool
 may have added or removed plugins.
methods.name: updateEventList
methods.comment:
Update the events that are consumed and produced, as the tool
 may have added or removed plugins.

methods.javadoc:
Verify that the given event name is produced by the
 producer tool and is consumed by the consumer tool.
@throws IllegalArgumentException if the event is not in the
 list of events for this producer/consumer pair.
methods.name: validateEventName
methods.comment:
Verify that the given event name is produced by the
 producer tool and is consumed by the consumer tool.

methods.javadoc:
Check the connections; if there are none, then remove the
 consumer tool as a listener on the producer tool; called
 when a disconnect is made.
methods.name: checkConnections
methods.comment:
Check the connections; if there are none, then remove the
 consumer tool as a listener on the producer tool; called
 when a disconnect is made.

name: ToolConnectionImpl
comment:
Implementation for representing connections between two tools.
 Acts as the middle man for the connection in order to filter the
 events.
